fields.summary: Full site search should show customised breadcrumbs for custom content

fields.description:
For publishing, need to be able to determine what needs to be updated when something changes... i.e. Page A changed, remote publish Page A and find all pages that embed Page A and update them
Also needed for tracking when a version is out of date due to attachments changing

[spec link|https://pug.jira-dev.com/wiki/spaces/CP/pages/2646376451/Spec+Embedded+content+api]
fields.summary: Querying embedded content

fields.description:
We are receiving feedback from customers reporting a malfunctioning on our addon.

com.balsamiq.mockups.confluence

Since this morning the addon is unable to fetch attachment from the Confluence page.
The download of the binary content is made from our server bas.balsamiq.com.

No changes has been made on our side to justify the error.

On new instances/subscription the addon is working as expected.

We are not able to replicate/debug the issue because on dev environment (i.e local server using ngrok) the addon works has expected.
fields.summary: Balsamiq Mockups for Confluence addon  is not authorized to fetch attachment

fields.description:
Connect macros (static and dynamic) produce only xhtml macros.  There should be nothing stopping us generating v1 macros (wiki markup macros) as well.

This will allow them to be rendered by the wiki renderer that is used when doing wiki markup imports.
fields.summary: Spike Wiki Markup versions of Connect Macros
Rename Properties enum to Property in Content-formatting macros plugin
Create EAP Cloud Instance for Gliffy

fields.description:
Add new "contentlist" target in navigator api.
"contentlist" should support page, blogpost and custom content.
fields.summary: Navigator should support navigate to list view

fields.description:
I'm currently creating a Confluence Connect add-on which makes use of dynamic content macros. Some of them are intended to be inline macros ("outputType": "inline"). Unfortunately, their content is not vertically aligned with the surrounding text because the generated iframe does not have "align=middle" set (or the HTML5 equivalent with CSS).

As an example, see the attached screenshot where "Hello world" is the output of my dynamic content macro (note that I've set the size optimally with AP.resize, otherwise scrollbars in the iframe would appear) which is not aligned with the surrounding text.

A possibility to change the rendering of iframes with Connect (beside setting their size with AP.resize) would greatly help here.
fields.summary: Allow to change the iframe rendering to vertically align inline macros

fields.description:
You get different behaviour with autoconvert depending on the formatting of the link.

If you copy a link: [http://google.com] (Right click copy) then paste it in to the editor, the autoconvert works properly.

If you use the mouse to select and drag the link text, then paste it in to the editor, the autoconvert does not match.
fields.summary: Formatted links not matching autoconvert
Publish a DAC blogpost about custom content

fields.description: https://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=2961708165
fields.summary: Go through Connect's System add-on approval process

fields.description:
We need to uninstall any manually installed content formatting macros from the db.  If this plugin was manually installed in to any instance then it will show up in the db which we can remove.  Similar to Gliffy (https://ops.internal.atlassian.com/jira/browse/HOT-47343). Please run this script on all confluence cloud instances. 

{noformat}
delete from PLUGINDATA
  where PLUGINKEY = 'com.adaptavist.confluence.contentFormattingMacros'
  or PLUGINKEY = 'com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.content-formatting-macros'
{noformat}

This will delete any manually installed version of the adaptavist plugin (plugin key: com.adaptavist.confluence.contentFormattingMacros) and the atlassian replacement (plugin key: com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.content-formatting-macros) as its now bundled.

To get this executed, we need a HOT ticket like this one: https://ops.internal.atlassian.com/jira/browse/HOT-47343
fields.summary: Uninstall all manually installed Content Formatting Macro installations

fields.description:
Currently static macros have the select macro button on the bottom left to go back to the macro selection page. If you have a macro with your own custom editor, it would be awesome to also include that button. It be nice if there was a Confluence connect api call to do that.

 !image-2017-03-02-15-37-36-774.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Include 'Select Macro' link on custom macro editor

fields.description:
When Cloud (OnDemand) users install our add-on, we would like to know the size of the instance they're running (in the number of users). This would allow us to gather better metrics from our customers.

Possible implementations:

* Pass the instance size when the install web hook is invoked
* Provide a REST endpoint for Add-Ons at any time (as instance size can change over time)
fields.summary: Let add-ons know the size of the instance they're installed on
Navigator context API for unsaved edit page

fields.description:
The confluence REST API which will eventually replace the XML-RPC API at the XML-RPC is deprecated. However the current REST API is deficient in that it does not provide the same functionality notably the following functionality 
* 
* exportSite
* exportSpace
* importSpace
fields.summary: Confluence REST API is deficient compared to the XML-RPC API
"Bad type on operand stack" in development
Fork create content plugin
Connect Training Material

fields.description:
That Confluence plugin we develop should connect to TFS (Team Foundation Server). Over an macro you can choose the Work Items from TFS and add them to a page from Confluence. That problem is, that we doesn’t know, how to get the current AD-User (Active Directory) Credentials from Confluence over the Atlassian Plugin SDK. The Target is to use the current AD-User credentials from Confluence Plugin to authentificate this user on TFS.

It is possible to lead through an logged Confluence user to an external system like TFS?
If it possible, can we get an code example or something like that?
fields.summary: lead an logged confluence user through to an external system

fields.description:
We may be able to fast the migration for a lot of instances if they do not need a data migration
* Find out exactly what the criteria would be (I suspect its the existence of any custom shape library) (Done)
* Work out a query that can be used to detect these instances (will be difficult but not impossible since they are in AO tables that can have obscured but deterministic names) (https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/SOPS/repos/uc-script-runs/pull-requests/424/overview Merged)
* Run the query over all p2 installed plugins (https://ops.internal.atlassian.com/jira/browse/HOT-48725)
* Work out any issues with replacing the p2 plugin with the connect add on (will the license just work? or is there a license migration) (Reached to [~bwoskow] for help on this.)

If this works as expected we may be able to drop the number of gliffy snowflakes dramatically as I suspect most people will not have custom shape libraries.
fields.summary: Detect Gliffy installations that do not need data migration

fields.description: Details: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFDEV-46581
fields.summary: Replace usage of ThreadLocalCache by ThreadLocalCacheAccessor in Confluence
Use content keyword counts in page categorisation calculations

fields.summary: Fix broken TestCustomContentUISupport.shouldRenderItemIconInSearchResult()

fields.description:
We're currently caching outbound server to server requests for static content macros in memory, and we encourage vendors to set caching headers in their responses to take advantage of this. In-memory caching will no longer be effective with the latest platform changes - one node will be servicing any number of tenants and the cache will become diluted.

We should change atlassian-http-client to have a vcache option for caching, rather than in memory (https://hc.apache.org/httpcomponents-client-ga/tutorial/html/caching.html).

Once we're no longer relying on the xdm_e query parameter to avoid cross-tenant leakage, we could also re-instate caching for blueprint context requests (and document it).
fields.summary: Make static content macros use a per-tenant cache

fields.description:
When adding text to the footer of Confluence using atl.footer web panel, center aligned text in the web panel does not aligned with the center aligned text in the footer.

This is because the Confluence footer has an inline style giving it left padding which is missing  in the web panel.

See the screenshot for an example:
!Screen Shot 2016-02-09 at 19.15.38.png|width=800!
fields.summary: atl.footer web panels need the same left padding as the footer

fields.description:
Content types from add-ons may store their data as the body of the content. We should at a minimum support body type raw so that we don't attempt to do storage format refactorings on content bodies that aren't actually storage format

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CRA-1307
fields.summary: ECTs should support body types other than storage

fields.description:
Post-ADG3 several code paths may become dead/deprecated and should be cleaned up once ADG3 has rolled out to 100% of users.

Please add to this ticket when you make any ADG3-specific changes to the Connect project.

---

* Custom content icons: Now handled by `icon` param in the sidebar web items, rather than `styleClass`. The latter can be deprecated.
* Condition on confluence-custom-content-common-css-resources in atlassian-plugin-confluence-customcontent.xml should be removed
*
fields.summary: Clean up dead, post-ADG3 code

fields.description:
My brief reading of the code suggests that the customContent module (see https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/AC/repos/atlassian-connect/browse/plugin/src/main/resources/css/confluence/customcontent/custom-content-icons.css.tpl) is producing css which contains vendor provided icon urls.

This won't work in vertigo - web resource module descriptors must be untenanted - the WRM system will not be modified to allow tenanted web resources - this is incompatible with prebaking / cross tenant cdn and other vertigo stuff we'd like to do. This is a bit vague - i'll update this with better doco if i find it.
fields.summary: Custom Content should not create tenanted WebResourceModuleDescriptor instances

fields.description: Confluence doesn't currently bundle the streams-thirdparty-plugin, which prevents P2 plugin developers from extending the activity streams provided by Confluence. We should bundle this with Confluence Server, to improve their development choices.
fields.summary: Bundle atlassian streams thirdparty plugin

fields.description:
Currently Connect macro parameters are appended to the URL as querystring parameters. This has the potentially to exceed URL length limits in browsers. The proposed workaround is request the parameters for the macro using the rest API so that you don't have to rely on the query parameters.

The downside of the workaround is that it is an "all or nothing scenario". i.e. There is no way to detect if a URL has been truncated or not, so if there's any risk of exceeding the URL limit, then you need to always request the macro parameters. This results in an additional round trip and reduced performance.

We should find a way to avoid the additional round trip.
fields.summary: Detecting issues with long macro URLs

fields.description: The Synchrony service that supports collaborative editing in Confluence 6.0 listens on port 8091 by default, however I already have a service listening to that port on my machine. How do I change the port that Synchrony tries to listen on?

fields.description:
https://pug.jira-dev.com/wiki/display/CE/Spike%3A+Rendering+Chart+macro+with+data+source+from+dynamic+connect+add-on

QA Feedbacks
* When two tables one inside chart one inside provider, macro preview has this error:
org.dom4j.DocumentException: Error on line 16 of document : The reference to entity "body" must end with the ';' delimiter. Nested exception: The reference to entity "body" must end with the ';' delimiter.
** Fixed. Script tags in preview mode aren't wrapped with CDATA but chart rendering logic is expecting valid XML.

* Export isn't working
** Fixed. Fallback to static macro

* Don't clear data when provider is not providing valid data.
** Won't fix. If add-on provides empty data then that's add-on's problem not chart's
fields.summary: Refactor chart macro to allow async datasource to support connect macro as a data table

fields.description:
As discussed on this PR: https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/AC/repos/atlassian-connect/pull-requests/2231/diff#confluence/confluence-protobuf/src/main/proto/CustomContentMessages.proto

We have a few examples in custom content where there are objects that are optional, but also have all their fields optional too. It makes more sense for these to be required, because if you've opted to define the optional object, it makes no sense to then leave it as empty.

This issue involves first checking that no one's marketplace descriptors will get broken by this change, and then changing the JSON bean/protobuf code to enforce these as required.
fields.summary: Custom Content: Change optional fields inside optional objects to required

fields.description: I'm trying include a _create space_ function in my connect add-on. unfortunately the REST API call I'd like to make namely, {{POST /rest/api/space}} is currently not catered for.

fields.description: The default set of permissions for new spaces can be configured per Confluence instance. For add-ons to use the create space api and set custom permissions, we need a way for them to get the default permission set to keep so they only adjust the ones they explicitly need to. Otherwise, if they call the API with just their permissions, they'll blow away the default set.
fields.summary: REST API should be able to get the set of default permissions for a space

fields.description:
With P2 Plugins, it is possible to configure the blueprint to skip the editor mode when created by the user. This can be done by adding the parameter *{color:red}create-result = "view"{color}*

With Atlassian Connect Add-ons there is no such parameter for the blueprint Module. 

Our company is migrating its plugins to the new cloud architecture, so this is a very needed feature for us.
fields.summary: Add view mode parameter for blueprints (Skip Editor)
REST Api Doc Review
Pug: Disable Adaptavist and enable all Content Formatting macros

fields.description:
For our addon we need to get a list of all other pages including a given page.
[~slancashire] mentioned the 'related content' API wrt. to incoming and outgoing links.

Please consider integrating the include macro with that API so we can use it to find all including pages. There are a couple of other macros that might also be worth adding to that list, for example the excerpt-include macro.

It would also be great if the relation had a type so we could distinguish between references (links) or inclusion (using the macros). This would help us to decide if we just need to check for page title changes (to restore inter-page links) or if we need to re-render the page content itself.
fields.summary: Improve Relations API to include outgoing links

fields.description:
rest/inlinetasks/{version}/my-task-report/

This extra REST endpoint would allow us to access space specific task data for the Clarity Statistics Connect addon. 

The endpoint would compliment the other (private) whitelisted Inline Tasks endpoint (/rest/inlinetasks/{version}/task). 

(https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/scopes/confluence-rest-scopes.html)
fields.summary: Add 'my-task-report' REST endpoint from Inline-Tasks to Connect whitelist

Add integration test for static content macros with rich text body, particularly testing requests to the REST API with the provided macro hash, which was broken in AC-1505.

fields.description:
Expose and document the API to clear the http level caches in the Connect http client.

There are REST api resources provided by {{com.atlassian.plugin.connect.confluence.macro.rest.MacroResource}} that allows remote manipulation of the http level cache.  Most notably is the ability to flush the cache for your add-on.  This will the use of more more aggressive cache strategies and flushing it when needed, ultimately resulting in a faster add-on.

----

Was:

For Numbered Headings connect we currently fetch the macro body and do a new call to transform it from the storage format to the view format (using the '/rest/api/contentbody/convert/view' endpoint). We then add numbering to this (view format) content and return this as the macro's result to Confluence.

In general this works fine. But we stumbled on an issue when the content contains a page include macro. When you edit the included page, the page on which it is included will not update. This is correct since we tell Confluence to cache the content for a day. And since we now return the fully rendered content, Confluence has no way of detecting macro's in the content itself (the conversion strips any notion of macro's). This did work when we did not convert the macro body before returning the numbered content.

I don't know how the cache clearing currently is triggered for included pages. But a possible solution would be to trigger a cache clear on the page on which an edited page is included (so edit included page > trigger cache clear on all pages that have this page included).
fields.summary: Expose REST API to manipulate connect http level cache
Provide generalPages for confluence with space sidebar decoration

fields.description:
Currently macro browser preview only works when macro uses AP.getMacroBody(), which is only available in the client side javascript API.  This API works by finding the body (or enough information to retrieve the body) from the currently loaded page.

Server-to-server add-ons will not have this information available and the AP.getMacroBody approach will not work.  In order to make server to server macro works we need to save the page draft when the preview refreshes.

_Server-to-Server add-ons refer to add-ons that collect the macro body from a call from the add-on server to Confluence directly and do this before responding to the macro request._
fields.summary: Server to Server macros cannot be previewed

fields.description:
When making a REST API call to Confluence to get a specific page and I mention "body.view" in the expand parameter, I should have the rendered format of the page. Instead, I get {color:#d04437}"MyAddOn is not responding. Wait or cancel ?"{color} where there should be rendered macros. When I tried the same thing with default confluence macros, there was no problem, macros are perfectly rendered. The problem is with Atlassian Connect add-ons. 

I don't know if this has anything to do with the mysterious{color:#d04437} ": = | RAW | = :" {color}parameter, because it is still there (see enclosed picture).

I need to render content on a Web Item to make my add-on work. I can't think of any other way to do this. I even tried the JSON-RPC API.

 Thank you
fields.summary: Macros are not rendered in the "view" version of the page body

fields.description: Status updates have been removed as a feature, so we need to update Connect (both the docs and any references in classes) to reflect this. For example, there are 3 webhooks related to status updates detailed [here|https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/1.1.33/modules/common/webhook.html].
fields.summary: Remove references to status updates from Connect

fields.description:
Gliffy Confluence 6.5.3 is ready for deployment to OnDemand.

See here: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.gliffy.integration.confluence/versions#b6240
.OBR available here: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/download/plugins/com.gliffy.integration.confluence/version/6240

Notable bug-fixes and improvements:

* High-resolution image export
* Shapes as links
* Android shapes
* Improved network shapes
* Diagram version pinning: specify the published version of a diagram using this new feature. When editing a Confluence page, select the Gliffy diagram macro, and click the "Version" button to specify the published/pinned version of a diagram.
* Full-screen viewer improvements
* Shape search improvements
* Fix for Firefox JS IndexSizeError
* Fix for link color rendering on legacy diagrams
* Numerous other bug fixes and stability improvements
* Some resources served from a CDN when in OnDemand / Cloud
* Diagram import improvements
* Full-screen viewer security vulnerability fix
* Confluence attachment macro button fix
fields.summary: Gliffy Confluence Plugin 6.5.3 is ready for release in OnDemand / Cloud

fields.description:
When a content body contains a macro that generates links to other content, converting the storage format to view format should render the link with content id, type, version (current version only) like CE-970 for simple links.

{code}
data-linked-resource-id
data-linked-resource-type
data-linked-resource-version (current version only)
{code}

Macros like this are:
Children Macro,
... This list can grow when we examine more macros.
fields.summary: Rendering process should render macro generated link with contentid, type, version

fields.description: I have a client who is requesting some integration with our Comala Workflows plugin and the Confluence Mobile Plugin. To explore all the options I'd like to get access to the Confluence Mobile Plugin (com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-mobile) source code. Unless I'm missing something this does not seem to be included in the application source code bundle.
